sn14.12:1.2.pli: “Sanidānaṁ, bhikkhave, uppajjati kāmavitakko, no anidānaṁ; sanidānaṁ uppajjati byāpādavitakko, no anidānaṁ; sanidānaṁ uppajjati vihiṁsāvitakko, no anidānaṁ.
sn14.12:1.2.en: “Mendicants, sensual, malicious, and cruel [38;5;121mthoughts arise[0m for a reason, not without reason.

sn14.12:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, sanidānaṁ uppajjati kāmavitakko, no anidānaṁ; sanidānaṁ uppajjati byāpādavitakko, no anidānaṁ; sanidānaṁ uppajjati vihiṁsāvitakko, no anidānaṁ?
sn14.12:2.1.en: And how do sensual, malicious, and cruel [38;5;121mthoughts arise[0m for a reason, not without reason?

sn14.12:6.1.pli: Sanidānaṁ, bhikkhave, uppajjati nekkhammavitakko, no anidānaṁ; sanidānaṁ uppajjati abyāpādavitakko, no anidānaṁ; sanidānaṁ uppajjati avihiṁsāvitakko, no anidānaṁ.
sn14.12:6.1.en: Thoughts of renunciation, good will, and harmlessness arise for a reason, not without reason.

sn14.12:7.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, sanidānaṁ uppajjati nekkhammavitakko, no anidānaṁ; sanidānaṁ uppajjati abyāpādavitakko, no anidānaṁ; sanidānaṁ uppajjati avihiṁsāvitakko, no anidānaṁ?
sn14.12:7.1.en: And how do thoughts of renunciation, good will, and harmlessness arise for a reason, not without reason?

an9.14:2.1.en: “Samiddhi, based on what do [38;5;121mthoughts arise[0m in a person?”

an9.14:11.1.pli: “‘Kimārammaṇā, samiddhi, purisassa saṅkappavitakkā uppajjantī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno ‘nāmarūpārammaṇā, bhante’ti vadesi.
an9.14:11.1.en: “Samiddhi, when you were asked what is the basis on which [38;5;121mthoughts arise[0m in a person, you answered ‘name and form’.
